chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 2/17/26.  DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include an counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with N.Y.A. or her biological parents or siblings. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.

Succcessfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
Complete a sex offender assessment and treatment.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also advised because he has been convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 if he possesses a firearm within five (5) years of completing his felony sentence, he will be subject to a mandatory three (3) year initial confinement sentence, also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been  restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (35 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 17, 2016 received and filed.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 343 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and surcharges are to be paid by 2/17/26, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 2/17/26, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact  with N.Y.A. or her biological parents or siblings. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
-Obtain/Maintain employment
-Complete a sex offender assessment and treatment
Court advised the defendant that he is subject to the sex offender registry and must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements; he was also advised that they cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires them to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age. 
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; Defendant also advised because he has been convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 if he possesses a firearm within 5 years of completing his felony sentence, he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement sentence; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

BRANCH 7 (McADAMS)  FOR  BRANCH 6 (BROSTROM)
Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Alexandra Wirth appeared today to interpret for the defendant.
for the 12-15-2015 at 8:30 AM Sentencing Hearing date before Judge Brostrom's Court.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE BROSTROM.....
Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in custody.  Michael Thurston for Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court AMENDED Count #1 to:  Child Enticement (Sexual Contact or Intercourse) [a Class D FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 948.07(1), 939.50(3)(d).  Count #2 is "deleted".

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case adjourned to 12-15-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 6, Judge Brostrom's Court for Sentencing Hearing.
Clerk CANCELED the 11-16-2015 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Brostrom's Court.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

prepared by ADA Kristin Schrank; filed by ADA Michael Thurston on behalf of the State.  Count #1 is AMENDED to:  Child Enticement (Sexual Contact or Intercourse) [a Class D FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 948.07(1), 939.50(3)(d).  Count #2 is "deleted".
Case spun to Branch 2, Judge Donald.
Defense counsel contacted Court to schedule a plea hearing.  Projected guilty plea scheduled for 11/10/15 at 8:30 am in Branch 6.

Case calendared for final pretrial conference.
Off the record discussion placed on the record.  Case remains in plea posture.  State informed the Court that considerable effort has been made to attempt to make victim notification.  State placed offer on the record.  Court found that the offer is not in the best interest of the public and Court does not accept the current plea negotiations.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on 11/16/15 at 10:00 am in Branch 6.  Parties informed the Court that the trial should last 3-4 days. Interpreters are needed for both the defendant and witnesses.

Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo for Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.
State has been made aware of possible defense witnesses.  State has not received any statements regarding these witnesses, but is aware of what testimony may be.  State placed offer on the record.  Defense acknowledged offer and requested more time to discuss offer.  Court ordered that victim notification needs to be made before any plea is taken, as this offer is a significant reduction.  Joint request for another final pretrial conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 6.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court, defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez not in court, in custody in holding area.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Held off the record.
ADA Huebner is unavailable for today's proceedings and requests an adjournment.  Defense counsel does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 6.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.    Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.

Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez.

Defendant has retain new counsel.  Defense request an adjournment of the 11/16/2015 jury trial date to review discovery.  State objects to last minute substitution of counsel.  Defense is fairly confident and will continue with the trial date.  Court orders case adjourned for another final pretrial date.  Court previousely made a finding as to the forensic video.  Court orders the forensic video SEALED.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant request court set bail at $5,000.00.  State objects and request court leaves bail as is.  Court denies defense motion.

Other matters are discussed.  Defense has not obtained an expert witness.  Court takes not position on further negotiations.

Attorney Rick Steinberg in court, defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez not in court, in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court in trial.  Case is adjourned for bail motion, final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 6.
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (23 pages) commencing 03/27/2015 received and filed.

Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Enrique Barbosa.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Andrew Wagner-MPD Officer, Miguel Cornejo-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Correspondence from ADA Mathy dated 3/25/15.

Defendant Agustin Hernandez-Vasquez in court, in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Yvon Roustan.
Defense Attorney Steinberg did appear this morning, informing the Court that he was informed by the State Public Defender's Office that this was calendared for the pm. Defense counsel is not available this afternoon.  State has no objection to an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BIA; NYA; witness CLH; witness Fabiola and her children

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
